target.name: Sect1
target.text: Steps for Installing ICEcore

target.name: Procedure
target.text: The following sequence shows the steps you want to follow to install ICEcore:

target.name: Step
target.text: Install JDK (Sun JDK 1.5.0_011 or higher).

target.name: Step
target.text: Set JAVA_HOME environment variable.

target.name: Step
target.text: Install and Configure the Database Server.

target.name: Step
target.text: Download the appropriate ICEcore kit.

target.name: Step
target.text: Edit the installer.xml file (see Editing the Installer (.xml) File).

target.name: Step
target.text: If you want to run the indexing service in ICEcore on a different machine from ICEcore, you have to Install the Lucene Index Server on the other machine.

target.name: Step
target.text: Run the installer (on Linux, do a chmod +x -(liferay|jboss).linux to make the installer executable).

target.name: Step
target.text: Start and Stop ICEcore.

target.name: Sect1
target.text: Editing the Installer (.xml) File

target.name: BridgeHead
target.text: For a quick installation edit the following sections:

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Change the Host name in the Network section. Change the port number to 80 and the securePort to 443 if this is a dedicated server.

target.name: Step
target.text: Change the Host name in the Network section. Change the port number to 80 and the securePort to 443 if this is a dedicated server.

target.name: Step
target.text: Consider changing the JavaVirtualMachine setting in the Memory section if you have a large installation.

target.name: Step
target.text: Use the default file system configuration. This stores the files in /home/icecoredata

target.name: Step
target.text: The default database configuration is MySQL, with the default MySQL passwords.

target.name: Step
target.text: Use the default Lucene configuration (unless you are installing a standalone Lucene Index Server.

target.name: Step
target.text: Modify the Email section with your SMTP and POP/IMAP servers.

target.name: Step
target.text: If you are using ICEcore Conference, change the settings in the Presence configuration.
